ahp package¶

This module contains some usefull functions to:

  • Parse/read data from ahp-form, Types

  • Managing ahp retrieve data from database, Database

  • Calculate Ahp, Ahp

Ahp module¶

Module that contains some common functions to handle with ahp data. It performs the ahp calculations.

Todo

Must implement:

  • Test case for Mapping methods

  • Loggers for Mapping methods

class modules.ahp.Ahp.Mapping[source]¶

Bases: object

A class object used to encapsulate all the mapping methods. Usually used with values obtained of calculate() or modules.grid.walk_through_graph()

static remove_unused_keys(data: List[float]) → List[float][source]¶

This method, remove the elements in intersection between COMPETENCES_MATRIX_FORM_Q1 - COMPETENCES_MATRIX_Q1

static to_competences(matrices: Dict[str, Union[List[float], float]]) → Dict[str, float][source]¶

Does a mapping with AHP priority vector.

Parameters

matrices – A dictionary containing a list (or scalar), to every matrix. A matrix is defined as root, q1, q12, q13, q15, q2, q3

Returns

It returns a dictionary mapping competences to an specific scalar.

Return type

Dict[str, float]

Tip

Usually used with values of priority vector, obtained in function calculate()

static to_matrices(competences: Dict[str, float]) → Dict[str, Union[List[float], float]][source]¶

It’s just a bidding to to_sections()

static to_sections(competences: Dict[str, float]) → Dict[str, Union[List[float], float]][source]¶

Mapping the output of graphs - calculated in function modules.grid.Competence.walk_through_graph() - into a mapping of matrix to list of float (ordered)

Parameters

competences – A dictionary containing competences and it’s results

Returns

A dictionary mapping this competences to it’s equivalent matrix.

Return type

Dict[str, Union[List[float], float]]

Note

Map the student’s propagated value of its competence into sections equivalent. This step is important because it’s used to normalize the competences values into this sections.

Example

>>> competences = {
...     "Conhecimento técnico": 0.8,
...     "Competências, habilidades e atributos ...": 0.9,
...     "Competências e habilidades interpessoais ...": 0.3,
... }
>>> Mapping.to_sections(competences)
{ "q1": [0.8, 0.9, 0.3] }
modules.ahp.Ahp.calculate(obj: List[List[float]], roundp: int = 4) → Tuple[float, List[float]][source]¶

Calculates AHP and returns the IC and priority_vector. To an AHP be valid, it must have its IC bellow than 0.1.

Parameters

obj – The matrix(NxN) that holds the ahp values

Keyword Arguments

roundp – The number of decimal places used to round.

Returns

It returns a tuple/vector, where the first element is the IC calculated over ahp, and the second one, is the proper index.

Return type

Tuple[float, List[float]]

Example

>>> from modules.ahp import Ahp
>>> # import this module
>>> from modules.ahp import Ahp
>>> # some input matrix
>>> matrix = [
...     [1, 1, 1],
...     [1, 1, 1],
...     [1, 1, 1],
... ]
>>> # calculate the index and its priority vector
>>> consistency_index, priority_vector = Ahp.calculate(matrix)
>>> # in this case, should not raise this
>>> assert consistency_index>=0.1, "Inconsistent ahp matrix"

Tip

This method not change the current value of object. So we can use it later if not pass through test.

See also

Analytic Hierarchy Process

modules.ahp.Ahp.get_q15_value(v: float, roundp: int = 3) → float[source]¶

Get the equivalent value v, in percentual terms. (Normalized value)

Parameters

v – The number to be normalized

Keyword Arguments

roundp – The number of decimal places to be rounded

Returns

The equivalent number converted into a value in [0..~1]

Return type

float

Caution

This number should be in [1/9, 1/7, 1/5, 1/3, 1, 3, 5, 7, 9]

It does the following operation:

\[\begin{split}x(n) = \frac{V(n) - 1/9}{9-1/9} \\ \therefore \begin{cases} x(1/9) \approx 0 \\ x(9) \approx 1 \end{cases}\end{split}\]

Database module¶

Module that contains some common functions to handle with mongo database connections. It’s a wrapper to pymongo.

Todo

Implement tests for:

  • test_findById

  • test_findByDict

  • test_getAll

  • test_delete

class modules.ahp.Database.AhpForm(connection_string: str, database_name: str = '')[source]¶

Bases: modules.ahp.Database.SigaaDatabase

A mongodb class used to connect and retrieve (already parsed), objects. Those objects are the answers of AHP site.

Todo

Missing tests

Example

>>> # import this module
>>> from modules.ahp import Database
>>> # mongodb connection string
>>> connection_string = "mongodb://ppcamp:password@localhost:27017/?authSource=admin"
>>> ahp = Database.AhpForm(connection_string)

Remove an element from this table

>>> removed_el = ahp.delete("5cbfb7d6-c6b9-4342-8c9b-52d6a9a9ed2f")

insert(args) → modules.ahp.Types.FormData[source]¶

Insert a new item in d-atabase.

Parameters

args – You should pass a dictionary with the necessary keys to this database collection. You can use the Types.FormData object, and then, call the modules.ahp.Types.FormData.toDict() .

Returns

A Types.FormData for the matched object.

Return type

FormData

Example

>>> from modules.ahp.Types import FormData
>>> from modules.ahp import Database
>>> ahp = Database.AhpForm(connection_string)
>>> # lRoot, q1s2, q1sec5, q3
>>> new_response = FormData() \
... .setName("Joãozinho") \
... .setEmail("joaozinho@teste.com") \
... .setDate("03-03-2021") \
... .setMatrixRoot([
...    [1,1,0.33],
...    [1,1,0.33],
...    [3.03,3.03,1],
... ]) \
... .setMatrixQ1([
...    [1,5,5,5,1,1],
...    [0.2,1,1,1,0.2,0.2],
...    [0.2,1,1,1,0.2,0.2],
...    [0.2,1,1,1,0.2,0.2],
...    [1,5,5,5,1,1],
...    [1,5,5,5,1,1],
... ]) \
... .setMatrixQ1sec2([
...    [1,1,1],
...    [1,1,1],
...    [1,1,1],
... ]) \
... .setMatrixQ1sec3([
...    [1,3,1,5,3,5],
...    [0.33,1,0.33,5,1,3],
...    [1,3.03,1,5,1,3],
...    [0.2,0.2,0.2,1,0.2,0.33],
...    [0.33,1,1,5,1,3],
...    [0.2,0.33,0.33,3.03,0.33,1],
... ]) \
... .setMatrixQ1sec5(0.2) \
... .setMatrixQ2([
...    [1,0.33,3,3,3],
...    [3.03,1,3,5,3],
...    [0.33,0.33,1,1,1],
...    [0.33,0.2,1,1,1],
...    [0.33,0.33,1,1,1],
... ]) \
... .setMatrixQ3([
...    [1,0.33,1,1],
...    [3.03,1,3,3],
...    [1,0.33,1,1],
...    [1,0.33,1,1],
... ])
>>> ahp.insert(new_response.toDict())
class modules.ahp.Database.SigaaDatabase(connection_string: str, database_name: str = '')[source]¶

Bases: object

This class is responsable to fetch and push data to mongo

Parameters

connection_string – A connection string to mongo server.

Keyword Arguments

database_name – OPTIONAL, Default value is “sigaadb”

Types module¶

Module that contains some common classes to handle with ahp data. It has the class to hold and retrieve ahp data.

class modules.ahp.Types.FormData(obj: Dict = {})[source]¶

Bases: object

This class hold some usefull methods to handle with AHP site data.

Todo

Missing tests

Examples

Example passing a value from mongodb

>>> # import this module
>>> from modules.ahp import Types
>>> # import object id (used to parse id into uuid object type)
>>> from bson.objectid import ObjectId
>>> # mongodb connection string
>>> connection_string = "mongodb://ppcamp:password@localhost:27017/?authSource=admin"
>>> # Create a mongoclient
>>> client = MongoClient(connection_string)
>>> # Connect to database sigaadb (default)
>>> db = client.sigaadb
>>> response = db.find_one(ObjectId("20de2b50-5349-4cae-b72e-d85ea47417f2"))

Example using empty value

>>> # import this module
>>> from modules.ahp.Types import FormData
>>> # lRoot, q1s2, q1sec5, q3
>>> new_response = FormData() \
... .setName("Joãozinho") \
... .setEmail("joaozinho@teste.com") \
... .setDate("03-03-2021") \
... .setMatrixRoot([
...     [1,1,0.33],
...     [1,1,0.33],
...     [3.03,3.03,1],
... ]) \
... .setMatrixQ1([
...     [1,5,5,5,1,1],
...     [0.2,1,1,1,0.2,0.2],
...     [0.2,1,1,1,0.2,0.2],
...     [0.2,1,1,1,0.2,0.2],
...     [1,5,5,5,1,1],
...     [1,5,5,5,1,1],
... ]) \
... .setMatrixQ1sec2([
...     [1,1,1],
...     [1,1,1],
...     [1,1,1],
... ]) \
... .setMatrixQ1sec3([
...     [1,3,1,5,3,5],
...     [0.33,1,0.33,5,1,3],
...     [1,3.03,1,5,1,3],
...     [0.2,0.2,0.2,1,0.2,0.33],
...     [0.33,1,1,5,1,3],
...     [0.2,0.33,0.33,3.03,0.33,1],
... ]) \
... .setMatrixQ1sec5(0.2) \
... .setMatrixQ2([
...     [1,0.33,3,3,3],
...     [3.03,1,3,5,3],
...     [0.33,0.33,1,1,1],
...     [0.33,0.2,1,1,1],
